{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3184983,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T10:58:16.243Z","cooked":"

I know the ink is not dry yet on the 2023 season but I‚Äôm anxious.

I‚Äôm looking for NH teams or very close to NH teams that would be willing to explore the idea of teaming up to find a space to build a full field.
We used the WPI field once or twice this year and its an incredible resource. I really don‚Äôt think you can simulate full field access.

Obivously there is a lot that goes into it, the most difficult being the actual venue itself.

My hope is if we can at least start forming a group of interested teams it will help us stay more organized.

So please reach out either here or dm to me if youd be interested!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T10:58:16.243Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":305,"readers_count":304,"score":176.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433688,"topic_slug":"colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire/433688/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3184989,"name":null,"username":"veg","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/3be4f8/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T11:16:20.906Z","cooked":"

This has been on our team‚Äôs long-term roadmap. There are so many benefits to be had from having access to a full practice field and a community build space.

In our area (suburban Boston), real estate is rather expensive. We have looked into the possibility of using empty warehouse space, but finding someplace we can use year-round is prohibitive. We are also looking at whether any soon-to-be-retired school facilities might become available. A corporate sponsorship would be really good here.

Another thing to know is that the lead time to purchase the generic field elements from AndyMark is about 8 months (last time I checked) and costs in excess of $20k before you add any season-specific game elements. I don‚Äôt know if that price also includes FMS hardware. You could conceivably make your field out of plywood and save some time/money. But you‚Äôll want to start fundraising early.

I don‚Äôt know if we are geographically close enough to go in together on a shared practice space, but I am interested to see how this project unfolds, and would love to help make it a reality.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T11:16:52.200Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":293,"readers_count":292,"score":83.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433688,"topic_slug":"colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48088,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire/433688/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3184991,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T11:22:08.320Z","cooked":"

Yeah theres a lot to it. Even just a realistic scale with wood elements would be a realistic upgrade for a lot of these teams.

Not to mention towards the end of build season being able to play some real matches would be awesome.

I don‚Äôt have a ton of concrete leads. More just ideas. My hope would be this space would end up in Manchester or Nashua, the latter definetly being some what commutable for your team? Not sure if its closer fhan other options thouvh

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T11:22:08.320Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":262,"readers_count":261,"score":52.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433688,"topic_slug":"colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48088,"username":"veg","name":null,"avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/3be4f8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire/433688/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3184992,"name":"Brendan Conover","username":"bcon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcon/{size}/169080_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T11:22:56.757Z","cooked":"

Andymark field perimeter is $25,000.
Electronics are another ~$5,000. (Not necessary though)
Total cost will be about $30,000, plus the little you need for the field elements every year.

It should also be noted that Andymark requires 50% of the $25,000 to be paid when you order the field, so having that 20-30k set aside already is probably the best idea if going for an Andymark practice field

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T11:22:56.757Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":75.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433688,"topic_slug":"colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire","display_username":"Brendan Conover","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48088,"username":"veg","name":null,"avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/3be4f8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"washed alum|frcdesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire/433688/4","custom_user_title":"washed alum|frcdesign.org","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3184994,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T11:28:31.453Z","cooked":"

Andymark field is definetly nice but I‚Äôm not sure i nesscarily view that as completely essential. At least in year 1.

Having a full scale field would be such an awesome resource. Even if we have to just cut plywood boards like its some backyard hockey rink!

Another thing i was thinking about‚Ä¶

I think most years the wood element versions of things are fine?

This year of course the charging station did matter a lot. But otherwise‚Ä¶

The practice field used by 20, 2791, 3044, 250 & a few others uses a fully wooden field perimeter made of plywood, it works for teaching drivers and honestly has very minor functional differences to the actual field perimeter and can be easily rearranged and modified for new games.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-04-12T14:17:55.576Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":77.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433688,"topic_slug":"colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":52398,"username":"bcon","name":"Brendan Conover","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcon/{size}/169080_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56369,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Making funky products"},"user_suspended":true,"post_url":"/t/colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire/433688/7","custom_user_title":"Making funky products","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3187597,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-12T14:21:25.895Z","cooked":"

If you are reliant on driving into the plexiglass to stop yourself or help with your driving, you‚Äôve got problems anyways. I don‚Äôt see a distinct advantage in spending all that money for the andymark field. Bet you could build it in under $1000 worth of wood.

Do you have any information on that practice field? Not familiar with those teams? Would be curious if someone‚Äôs already figured out a good board system

The field has a plywood mimic of the andymark perimeter, plywood game pieces, & then the charge pad is plywood coated with Lexan to mimic the traction. Team 20 - 2023 Robot Reveal - Aster - Charged Up - YouTube

That is awesome!

We gotta find the space to build up one of those. Thats exactly what I‚Äôm going for!

No clue what quality of playwood that is, but even at 30$ per 4x8 sheet, which you could rip into 2, you should be able to build a field up for $500 or less. Probably more, still not bad though‚Ä¶ just some labor!

Awesome, were in very early beginnings anyways. Just trying to get organized.

Its really all about space. Our school I guess in the past has taken issue with insurance and some of that, so thats another obstacle‚Ä¶ but finding an appropriate venue is priority 1.

Hey Joe,

A few mentors from other southern NH teams and myself have actually been working on this project for a month or so now. We have a few leads on a potential space, as well as a possible source of funding to buy an official AndyMark field perimeter. We‚Äôd be happy to merge some of this effort. We‚Äôre currently at the part of the process where we probably need to stand up a non-profit to manage the field and space, insurance stuff, and collect funding for the space. Having this nonprofit is in my opinion an important step, so that the field doesn‚Äôt live or die by the whim of one team in SNH.

We really value this space and know many teams from both southern NH and Northern MA would feel the same.

brennan-macaig:

A few mentors from other southern NH teams and myself have actually been working on this project for a month or so now. We have a few leads on a potential space, as well as a possible source of funding to buy an official AndyMark field perimeter. We‚Äôd be happy to merge some of this effort. We‚Äôre currently at the part of the process where we probably need to stand up a non-profit to manage the field and space, insurance stuff, and collect funding for the space. Oh dang! Did not realize. I‚Äôd love to be involved if possible. Sounds like you are much further than I am. I‚Äôd love to help.

I‚Äôm less sold on the need for the official field but would never complain about having one

Hey Joe,
Up here in the Maine Mall, we have a full field practice space. AndyMark perimiter, full drivers station, and game elements. We have had teams from NH come over to use it (319, 3467) and we are generally open for any team to come and practice.

I know there‚Äôs a plan for stuff in NH going forward like Brennan mentioned, but up here in Maine we are close to having a permanent STEM innovation center. IDK what the plan is for the interim with that project, but if you wanted to come and use it for next season while your space is being constructed we‚Äôd love to have you.

Thats so cool!
Think I‚Äôve heard about your field.

Kinda my main goal is to try to establish something nearby. Modtly so late in the build season we can do sustained practice less than an hour away. Ogherwise we‚Äôll get lazy and just go once or twice!

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2023-04-13T20:37:12.601Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":28.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433688,"topic_slug":"colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49402,"username":"e172","name":"E L","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/e172/{size}/256379_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/colloborative-practice-spaces-in-new-hampshire/433688/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212430,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-05T12:14:24.515Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôve reached out to a few spaces near Amherst New Hampshire but no dynamite lead. Still working though!

I‚Äôve basically spent the past month driving around thinking to myself ‚Äòwould that building be big enough to hold a full field‚Äô. 90% of the time the answers no lol. Then like 8% of the time beyond that you could probably be certain that even if they can hold a full field, there‚Äôs no way they are going to have the excess space for it.

One of my ideas (well, kinda‚Ä¶sparked a little bit by the teams in Maine using mall space) that would have probably have been a year too late was seeing if we could temporarily use where the old Sears was at the Pheasant Lane Mall in Nashua, NH. Its a huge space that I don‚Äôt think there are a lot of potential customers for‚Ä¶ just given the space alone. I know for a while it was used as a covid vaccination center. But that recently sold

Just figured I‚Äôd give a small update‚Ä¶ no good progress yet but its still early. The venue and all the complications that come around getting permission and agreement from the high schools to use that is really the number 1 priority for me. Actually building the field is #2!

On the mall front. We‚Äôve had some very tentative discussions with Steeple-Gate considering they have a lot of empty space but unfortunately it hasn‚Äôt gone anywhere. I‚Äôm definitely interested in any progress y‚Äôall can make because while the WPI field is fantastic, it‚Äôs a bit far for night trips on school nights. Getting something in NH would be an absolute game changer.
